summary:
Covers malware, phishing, ransomware, DDoS, social engineering, and password attacks. Explore the various types of cyber attacks that threaten organizations and individuals.  Learn about malware (viruses, worms, trojans), phishing attacks, ransomware, DDoS attacks, social engineering techniques, and password-based attacks. The lesson includes detailed explanations, visual aids, and assessment tools to ensure mastery of the concepts.

This topic provides essential knowledge for understanding cybersecurity at the Junior level. Through comprehensive study, students will develop a deep understanding of the concepts, principles, and applications related to Types of Cyber Attacks. The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in real-world contexts. This topic provides comprehensive coverage essential for understanding cybersecurity at the beginner level. Through detailed study, students will gain deep insights into the concepts, principles, and real-world applications. The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in various contexts.
